key_risks: Regulatory risks related to labor laws, tax regulations, and data privacy standards
Data security breaches exposing sensitive personal information
Intense competition from established players and emerging fintech companies
Economic sensitivity due to reliance on small to medium-sized businesses
Pricing pressure from commoditization and low-cost competitors
controversies: Significant data breach in March 2024 exposing Social Security numbers
environmental_issues: Commitment to reducing carbon footprint and promoting remote work
social_issues: Potential impact on client trust and legal liabilities due to data breaches
governance_issues: Regulatory compliance challenges and potential operational disruptions

sources.title: Paychex Data Breach Lawsuit Investigation | ClassAction.org
sources.snippet: Paychex discovered on April 30, 2024, that during the mandatory exchange of unclaimed property information with the State of California, a data breach occurred. Specifically, the company reported that personal details, including full names and Social Security numbers, were inadvertently disclosed to an unauthorized individual on March 22, 2024.
